summary: Wildlife trafficking is a multibillion-dollar, global criminal activity that imperils thousands of species. To help combat it, the U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service and the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration can offer rewards in certain circumstances for information on wildlife trafficking activities. We found that these agencies have not prioritized offering rewards, and they have paid few of them—27 rewards in 11 fiscal years, totaling...
title: Combating Wildlife Trafficking: Opportunities Exist to Improve the Use of Financial Rewards
